DOC.TEXT: The stock market was little changed today, continuing the trendless pattern that prevailed on Tuesday. The Dow Jones average of 30 industrials slipped .22 to 2,709.04 in the first half hour of trading. Gainers outnumbered losers by about 6 to 5 in nationwide trading of New York Stock Exchange-listed issues, with 452 up, 376 down and 557 unchanged. Volume on the Big Board came to 14.90 million shares as of 10 a.m. on Wall Street. Analysts found little in the economic news to stir the market out of its recent lethargy. Interest rates were narrowly mixed in the credit markets. Traders also appeared to be unsettled by doubts that a significant yearend rally was in the making. Hilton Hotels fell 5{ to 84\ on a report that efforts to sell the company had attracted lower bids than had been predicted. The NYSE's composite index of all its listed common stocks rose .10 to 191.82. At the American Stock Exchange, the market value index was up .29 at 371.09. On Tuesday the Dow Jones industrial average fell 2.13 to 2,709.26. Advancing issues were slightly ahead of decliners on the NYSE, with 712 stocks rising, 664 falling and 552 unchanged. Big Board volume totaled 77.61 million shares, compared with 120.98 million the previous session.
